thread.title: The Micromax Dual 5 boasts a 5.5-inch FHD display, dual 13MP rear cameras and 128GB storage, yours for Rs 24,999
thread.title_full: The Micromax Dual 5 boasts a 5.5-inch FHD display, dual 13MP rear cameras and 128GB storage, yours for Rs 24,999

title: The Micromax Dual 5 boasts a 5.5-inch FHD display, dual 13MP rear cameras and 128GB storage, yours for Rs 24,999
text:
Home Android Phones The Micromax Dual 5 boasts a 5.5-inch FHD display, dual 13MP rear... The Micromax Dual 5 boasts a 5.5-inch FHD display, dual 13MP rear cameras and 128GB storage, yours for Rs 24,999 By March 29, 2017 “The Dual 5 features three 13MP cameras, 4GB RAM and 128GB of storage” 
Micromax has joined the club of dual camera-toting smartphone makers with the launch of the Dual 5. It is a loaded offering with two 13-megapixel rear sensors – one RGB and monochrome. It also gets 4K and 3D video recording support and a Bokeh mode. For selfies and video calling, it gets a 13-megapixel front-facing shooter with a soft LED flash and f/2.0 aperture. The device also features a premium all-metal unibody design. 
As far as the other specs go, the Micromax Dual 5 features a 5.5-inch full HD Super AMOLED 2.5D curved display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3, and boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow. The phone is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 652 processor, mated to 4GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 128GB, which can be further increased by inserting a microSD card. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G LTE, VoLTE, a USB Type-C port, hybrid dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and GPS. The device also features a fingerprint scanner at the rear, and an IR emitter up top. A 3,200mAh battery with Quick Charge 3.0 fast charging keeps the phone running. The phone’s battery can charged to 90 percent levels in 45 minutes. 
Micromax says the Dual 5 is one of the most secure Android phones around, thanks to the independent security chip which encrypts and stores personal user data such as passwords and fingerprints. The device also offers various security features at the software level to protect user privacy. There’s an anti-theft mode on the device, which locks the phone whenever someone tries to access the SIM slot. 
As per the brand, the phone can’t be shut down without authentication, and can be tracked in case of theft. The handset will delete all secure data if the user doesn’t unlock it within 60 minutes of unauthorised access to the SIM slot. It also gets an extra hardware key, which can be customised to open the camera app and so on. 
As for the pricing, the Micromax Dual 5 has been priced at Rs 24 ,999, and comes bundled with a one-year replacement warranty. It will available from April 10th on Flipkart, Micromax e-store and via major brick-and-mortar retail stores across the country. The company also said that another smartphone in the series called the Dual 4 is coming soon. Facebook Comments
